results.title: Rat and rat tat
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, Ken Turnbull and Ray Cowling
results.brief_description: A play on the phonic, graphic and semantic relationships of words, designed for children who have already learned basic phonic-graphic correspondences. Includes several methods of blending in the movements of the animated letters. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Rashomon = In the woods
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, Jinkichi Minoura and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: A woodcutter (Takashi Shimura) witnesses a horrific series of events: A noble man (Mayasuki Mori) and his wife (Machiko Kyo) are ambushed by the famous bandit Tajomaru (Toshiro Mifune). The wife is raped and the nobleman is killed in a duel. Tajomaru is arrested and tried. In the telling of the tale in front of the judge, however, each of the four participants - the bandit, the wife, the woodcutter, the ghost of the murdered nobleman - gives a different view of what actually happened. Is any of them telling the truth? Akira Kurosawa leaves us to ponder the subjective nature of Truth. In this work he borrows heavily from Japan’s artistic tradition, specially kabuki theatre, where events are often repeated with slight variations. Winner of Golden Lion, Venice, 1951. Adapted from two original stories by Ryunosuke Akugatawa (“Rashomon” and “In a grove”).

results.title: Rarg (K)
results.creator_credit: Tony Collingwood Productions, Christopher O'Hare and Tony Collingwood
results.brief_description: This is the true story of Rarg, a land so perfect that the sun never rose until it was absolutely sure everyone was awake. Everybody in Rarg was happy, until, one day, they discovered they were just a dream in the mind of a man called Edwin Barnes. To save the land of Rarg, they must stop Edwin Barnes waking up. Written by Tony Collingwood. Cast includes Nigel Hawthorne as the storyteller.

results.title: Rapunzel in suburbia
results.brief_description: This film offers a unique opportunity to discover the personality and style of one of Australia’s most prominent authors. Dorothy Hewitt thoroughly engages her audience with stories of her life, comments on her philosophy and discussion of her major works.

results.title: Rapunzel
results.brief_description: Olivia Newton-John and friends present this timeless classic. Locked in a tower by the evil witch Scarlotta, Rapunzel’s glorious long hair provides the only bridge between Rapunzel and her handsome Prince. The two lovers are discovered by Scarlotta who punishes the Prince by turning him into a bird and banishes Rapunzel to the forest. Please note, there is a TCR counter in the top left hand corner throughout the transmission.

results.title: Raptures : an underwater odyssey
results.creator_credit: David Hannan Productions, David Hannan and Lucy Trippett
results.brief_description: David Hannan and his team have travelled to new locations to films this sequel to the fantastic “Coral Sea dreaming”. This extroadinary musical documentary is the culmination of 7 years filming in Micronesia, the Indian Ocean, the Coral Sea and the Great Barrier Reef. Stunning new cinematic techniques deliver vision of exceptional quality complemented by a musical score composed by Vance Burrow. This is an intoxicating musical journey capturing the beauty and diversity of our fragile ocean realm which can be used as a tool for stress release and meditation

results.title: Rapt
results.brief_description:
A virtual body built from Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scans of the artist’s body. MRI scans map the water content of the body to produce axial slices. These scans were used to create a 3D body accessible on any plane, making it possible to navigate through the body, and to view it internally and externally.

(Special thanks to Ray Scan Imaging and The Childrens’ Hospital Westmead Sydney)
